sentences: Choi Seung-hyun (Korean: 최승현; born November 4, 1987), better known by his stage name T.O.P, is a South Korean rapper, singer, songwriter, record producer and actor.
section: N/A

sentences: He used to perform as an underground rapper before joining the record label YG Entertainment and debuting as the main rapper for the boy band Big Bang in 2006.
section: N/A

sentences: The group became one of the best-selling groups of all-time in Asia and one of the best-selling boy bands in the world.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2010, while the group was on hiatus, T.O. P and G-Dragon collaborated to release the album, GD & TOP.
section: N/A

sentences: As a solo rapper, he has released two digital singles, "Turn It Up" (2010) and "Doom Dada" (2013), that have peaked at number two and four, respectively, on the Gaon Digital Chart.
section: N/A

sentences: T.O. P made his acting debut in 2007 through the TV series I Am Sam (2007), followed by Iris (2009) and the TV movie Nineteen (2009).
section: N/A

sentences: He made his film debut with 71: Into the Fire (2010), for which he received praise and won multiple accolades including Best New Actor at the 2010 Blue Dragon Film Awards and the 2011 Baeksang Arts Awards.
section: N/A

sentences: Subsequently, he garnered lead roles in the films Commitment (2013), for which he was awarded New Asian Actor of the Year at the Busan International Film Festival and Tazza: The Hidden Card (2014).
section: N/A

sentences: Born and raised in Seoul, South Korea, Choi Seung-hyun is the great nephew of Korea's pioneering abstract art artist Kim Whanki and grew up in contact with art due to his family.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: Since a young age, Choi became interested in hip hop.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: He and fellow future Big Bang member Kwon Ji-yong were "neighborhood friend[s] from middle school" and often danced and rapped together.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: Although Kwon later moved away and the two "became distant", Choi was contacted by Kwon when YG Entertainment, Kwon's record label, was scouting for possible candidates to create a boy group.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: By then, Choi had already performed on many underground stages at hip hop clubs and established a reputation as an underground rapper with the stage name Tempo.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: In 2003 under the name of Tempo, he was the winner of KBS Radio's Rap Battle.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: After contact,
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: Choi subsequently recorded several demos with Kwon and sent them to Yang Hyun-suk, CEO of YG Entertainment, who later asked he to audition.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: Choi was initially rejected by the record label, which deemed him too "chubby" to fit the "idealistic version" of an idol.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: He later "went home and exercised really hard because I wanted to join YG Entertainment," losing 20 kg in 40 days.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: Six months later, Choi returned for another audition and was signed.
section: == Life and career == | === 1987–2006: Career beginnings and debut with Big Bang ===

sentences: Given the stage name of T.O.P. (Korean: 탑) by senior YG artist Seven, he became one of two rappers alongside G-Dragon (Kwon's stage name) in Big Bang.

sentences: The two were paired with four others: Taeyang, Daesung, Seungri and Hyunseung and a documentary leading up to their debut was aired to promote them.

sentences: Hyunseung was later dropped by Yang, and Big Bang made its official debut with five members.

== Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse =
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===
== Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: T.O. P began his two-year mandatory military service on February 9, 2017, as a conscripted police officer, where he was set to be discharged on November 8, 2018, after completing the requirements.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: After news broke in June that he would be prosecuted without detention for use of marijuana, T.O. P was subsequently transferred to a different police division to await notice of prosecution, and was suspended from police duty pending verdict on his case.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: A few days after the announcement, T.O. P was found unconscious in police barracks due to a suspected anti-anxiety medicine overdose of prescribed benzodiazepine, and was hospitalized.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: On June 8, T.O. P's mother confirmed that he regained consciousness and was recovering.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: On June 29, at his first trial for the marijuana usage charges at the Seoul Central District Court, T.O. P pleaded guilty, admitting that he did smoke marijuana in four instances in early October 2016 and received two years of probation.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: After undergoing a disciplinary review by the police to decide if T.O. P should return as a conscripted policeman or  complete his service as a public service officer, T.O. P was eventually assigned reservist status by the Ministry of National Defense and transferred from the police department to complete his mandatory service as a public service worker.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: He resumed his mandatory service as public service officer at the Yongsan Arts and Crafts Center in central Seoul on January 26, 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: Afterwards T.O. P was discharged on July 6, 2019.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

sentences: His dispensation took place officially two days later.
section: == Life and career == | === 2017–2019: Military service, legal issues and downturn with substance abuse ===

== Artistry ==

sentences: Artistry ==
section: == Artistry ==
== Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: Musical style and songwriting ===
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: T.O. P and Big Bang have been praised for their individuality and ability to fuse a pop sound with rap, R&B and dance elements.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: T.O. P possesses a bass vocal range.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: Columnist Jeff Benjamin of Billboard K-Town noted how he is known for his low-bass timbre rapping, while fellow journalist Tamar Herman, wrote that T.O. P's rap is "an integral part to the group's sound" and that he tends to favor an "confident, almost mocking, tone".
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: Adrienne Stanley of Kpop Starz also praised the rapper for his "speed and accuracy" when delivering bars.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: Both his solo releases – "Turn It Up" and "Doom Dada" – are hip hop influenced, with the latter drawing critical acclaim for its "lyrical rhythms [that] are both inviting and alienating" from Dazed magazine, that declared that T.O. P was leading the evolution of K-Pop.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: Additionally, Billboard noted how the song's melody "is magnetizing with its whirring synths, tribal beats, and chanting, all of which pale in comparison to the rapper’s aggressive, multi-tonal delivery of his verses," affirming that T.O. P "revealed his true artistry" with the song.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: While working on materials with G-Dragon for their subunit, the two experimented with different styles.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: Co-writing majority of the lyrics, the pair noted that as "rappers [...] we'd like to tell more stories for our fans to listen."
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: In an attempt to create their own style away from their band, the duo opted for a more hip hop sound to contrast the Big Bang's current genre at the time, electronic music, though the influence of this genre along with R&B and acoustic was acknowledged.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: The duo also admitted to becoming "much more diverse [in their] attempts" to create their own style, preferring to mix several genres together in order to "bring out more of our character that we don't get to show when we're Big Bang.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: "T.O.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: P often edits his lyrics "more than a hundred times," and draws inspirations from "things that don’t speak.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: [From] beautiful and pretty objects rather than people."
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: While hip hop is his primary music consumption, he also listens to classical music and particularly enjoys the English rock band Pink Floyd.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: He also notes how his role as a musician influenced his acting to be more emotional.
section: == Artistry == | === Musical style and songwriting ===

sentences: While internationally, Big Bang is often referred to as a "K-pop" group, T.O. P has expressed distaste with the label noting how "[y]ou don't divide pop music by who's doing it.

== Philanthropy ==

sentences: Philanthropy ==
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In August 2014, T.O. P joined the Ice Bucket Challenge, an international campaign to develop medical treatment for Lou Gehrig's disease, also known as Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: He made a donation to the Seungil Hope Foundation, a non-profit organization that provides aid to Lou Gehrig patients.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In October 2016, in partnership with British auction house Sotheby's, he curated a collection of contemporary art as part of a special charity auction in Hong Kong.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: The project was named #TTTOP, and it featured 28 works by both Asian and Western artists.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: The auction saw a sale of more than HK$ 135 million and a portion of the proceeds was donated to the Asian Cultural Council (ACC) to support emerging Asian artists.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: In March 2020, T.O. P donated 100 million won to the Hope Bridge Disaster Relief Association, which announced that it would use the donation to purchase supplies for the medical teams responsible for combating the COVID-19 pandemic.
section: == Philanthropy ==

sentences: On November 4, 2018, in celebration of his birthday, T.O. P's fans from four Asian countries donated ₩11 million (US$9,900) in his name to the Yongsan Welfare Foundation to help the less fortunate.
section: == Philanthropy ==
